messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Enigmatic Embassy Episode DATE: 05/05/76 The courtroom was a locus of intense scrutiny as the trial unfolded. The prosecution brought forward the officers vital to the investigation to shed light on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Adams, the chief investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Captain Adams. Can you elucidate on the events on the night the episode occurred? WITNESS: Absolutely. On the night of September 9th, Officer C. D. Davis spotted a suspicious individual near the embassy and reported it. The investigation started forthwith. PROSECUTOR: Who headed the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Franklin and Technician G. H. Harrison managed the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who directed the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Johnson and K. L. King conducted the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense initiated a thorough cross-examination of Captain Adams regarding the investigative procedures. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Patterson, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Roberts were also called to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Adams 
Officer Context: Captain Adams is the chief investigator in the Enigmatic Embassy Episode case, elucidating on the events on the night the episode occurred during the trial. 
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis observed a suspicious individual near the embassy on the night of September 9th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Franklin 
Officer Context: Sergeant Franklin, alongside Technician G. H. Harrison, headed the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harrison 
Officer Context: Technician Harrison worked with Sergeant E. F. Franklin on the forensic analysis concerning the suspicious activity near the embassy. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Johnson 
Officer Context: Detective Johnson, alongside Detective K. L. King, directed interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the episode. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. King 
Officer Context: Detective King, along with Detective I. J. Johnson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Patterson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Patterson was also summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Roberts 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Roberts was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
